transcription: scholarship and second runner-up Miss Knoxville Brianna Mason.  She will receive a new automobile from Barry Carver of the Sierra Chevrolet of Nashville. She will receive a wardrobe from Joann's of Union City for her competition wardrobe at the Miss America Pageant. She will serve as Governor Haslam's character education spokesperson for the school children of Tennessee, courtesy of FTB advisors. And she will be Tennessee's representative at the Miss America Pageant in Atlantic City. Winner of a $9,000 scholarship, your first runner-up,  Miss Gallatin!
